name: Emu
description: Easily distinguished from other ratites by its densely feathered neck. Its strong, three-toed legs testify to its running ability—emus can reach speeds of nearly 50 km/h.
image_alt: Emu, photo: Tomáš Adamec, Prague Zoo
proportions: Body length 1.5–1.9 m; no tail; weight 30–45 kg
attractions: In emus, the father primarily cares for the offspring. He alone incubates the eggs for nearly two months, fasting throughout. He does not abandon the striped chicks for at least another six months.
breeding: As early as 1933–1934, males Pepík and later Pepík II lived at the zoo. The first came from Kludský Circus, the second via Hagenbeck. Records from 1946–1974 are sadly missing, but since then, emu breeding has continued uninterrupted to this day.
